all the employees at paypal i put
employees at paypal
at the top of that list because i think
the only
sustainable competitive advantage that a

is the strength of their employees the
talent that you can attract and retain
the passion that those employees have
and if you ever stand a chance from
moving from being a good company to a
great company
it's because you have great employees
and so
we did a survey of our employees
um and asked them um
how well they felt financially were they
financially healthy
and i did this survey by the way a
little bit
selfishly because paypal pays
above market rates typically anywhere we
hire people
and i expected the results to be quite
good and i was going to talk about them
at an all-employee meeting
and what i found actually is that
two-thirds of our entry-level employees
and
call center employees actually struggled
to make
ends meet at the end of the month they
were financially stressed
they had higher absenteeism rates as a
result of that
they were actually having to choose
between getting health care benefits for
their family or putting food on the
table
and that was just unacceptable to me i
mean our whole mission as a company is
to democratize financial services and so
um i slashed health care benefits by
60 percent for those employees we raise
salaries we have everyone in the company
equity so they could be part of the
success
of paypal and wrapped all that in a
financial education program
and really importantly adi we put a
measure on this because people talk
about living wage
but you never really understand what it
is and we
develop something called net disposable
income how much
income does somebody have left over
after they pay all of their taxes and
essential
living expenses and that obviously
changes location by location
but for these entry-level employees what
we found
is their ndi was as low as four percent
and we set a target of 20
so to increase ndi by four to five times
today we're at 16
ndi and hopefully next year we'll get to
our goal of 20
so so what's the what's the cost of that
and how do you sell that cost
to your other stakeholders including
shareholders
yep well it's significant amount
of investment that we put in but i can't
really think of any other place where
i'd rather invest my money
than in our employees i mean think about
it
if you have great employees that are
passionate
about the success of paypal that are
passionate and
proud to work there then they deliver
better for customers and if you deliver
better for customers over at least the
medium term
you deliver better for uh shareholders
and so we've seen a dramatic reduction
in nutrition an all-time high
in the pride at working at paypal
productivity is up
substantially and so although we made a
major investment
in this i think the benefits um to me at

say
when we announced all of this at an
all-employee meeting
um it was probably one of the

um because i really believe that if

i think it's it's worse to put something

honestly this isn't about being

it's not about um what i care about

uh why they're proud to work at paypal
